com.konakart.al

Class KKAppEng

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.konakart.al.KKAppEng

  • public class KKAppEng
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the entry point for all method calls to the KonaKart client engine. The idea behind the client engine is that each application user instantiates a copy and continues to use the same copy which keeps state for the user. The Struts Actions call methods to retrieve data from the server engine or perform transactions, whereas the JSPs normally call methods to display data which has been cached by the client engine.

    This object can be used to get an instance of one of the manager objects such as the CustomerMgr() and the CategoryMgr(). It can also be used to get an instance of the server engine using the getEng() method. Examples of how to use these calls can be obtained from the Struts Action Classes which are shipped in source code format.

        public void refreshCachedData()
                       throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                              KKAppException
        Refresh the cached data. It is the ConfigCacheUpdater that calls this method when the configuration variables have been changed. At the start of the day to do the first initialization it is also called from firstTimeRefresh();

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(java.lang.String locale)
               throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                      KKAppException
        Splits the locale string at the underscore and calls public void setLocale(String lowerCaseCode, String upperCaseCode)
        Parameters:
        locale - Locale which should be in the format en_GB
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(java.lang.String lowerCaseCode,
             java.lang.String upperCaseCode)
               throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                      KKAppException
        Used to change the locale of the application from the default locale. The category tree already exists for all locales and all calls to the engine use the new locale so that product descriptions etc. are in the correct language. For the case of en_GB, the lower case code would be "en" and the upper case code would be "GB".
        Parameters:
        lowerCaseCode - This is the two letter country code in lower case characters (i.e. it, en etc.)
        upperCaseCode - This is the two letter country code in upper case characters (i.e. IT, GB etc.)
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

      • getLocale

        public java.lang.String getLocale()
        Get the current locale in String format (lowerCaseCode_upperCaseCode). For example en_GB.
        Returns:
        Returns the current locale in String format

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the value of a property from the konakart_app.properties file. Within the properties file the "key" value is prepended by "konakart.app" so for example to read the property "konakart.app.engineclass" you need to pass in a key of "engineclass".
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the property or null if the key is null or the key's value isn't found

      • getPropertyAsBoolean

        public boolean getPropertyAsBoolean(java.lang.String key,
                           boolean def)
        Returns the value of a property from the konakart_app.properties file. Within the properties file the "key" value is prepended by "konakart.app" so for example to read the property "konakart.app.main.page.hide.recently.viewed" you need to pass in a key of "main.page.hide.recently.viewed".
        Parameters:
        key -
        def - The default value
        Returns:
        Returns the boolean value of the property or the default value of "def" if the property doesn't exist or isn't "true" or "false"

        public java.lang.String formatPrice(java.math.BigDecimal number)
                             throws KKAppException
        Used to create a string in order to visualize a price. It ensures that the decimal places, the thousands separator and the currency symbol are correct. Uses the default currency.
        Parameters:
        number - to be formatted
        Returns:
        The formatted price
        Throws:
        KKAppException

      • formatPrice

                           java.lang.String currencyCode)
                             throws KKAppException
        Used to create a string in order to visualise a price. It ensures that the decimal places, the thousands separator and the currency symbol are correct. An entry must exist in the database for the currency code passed in as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        numberToFormat - number to be formatted
        currencyCode - Three letter currency code (USD, GBP, EUR etc.)
        Returns:
        The formatted price
        Throws:
        KKAppException

      • isDdAsAttachment

        public boolean isDdAsAttachment()
        The value is read from the DD_DOWNLOAD_AS_ATTACHMENT configuration variable. When set to true, the digital download product is downloaded as an attachment that can be saved to disk. When set to false, the digital download product may be viewed within the browser.
        Returns:
        Returns the ddAsAttachment.

      • setDdAsAttachment

        Parameters:

      • getStoreId

        public java.lang.String getStoreId(java.lang.String defaultStoreId)
        Return the storeId. If the storeInfo object has a non-null storeId we return the storeId stored in that object. If the storeInfo object is null or its storeId is null we return a default storeId. The default storeId is the one provided as an input (could be from konakart_app.properties) or the cdefault store constant if the storeId passed in is null.
        Parameters:
        defaultStoreId - default storeId
        Returns:
        Return the storeId

      • removeSingleQuotes

        public java.lang.String removeSingleQuotes(java.lang.String in)
        Removes single quotes from the string by substituting them with double quotes. Currently used to prepare strings to send to Google Analytics because a string like De'Longhi for product name causes an exception in the JS on the browser. Substituting with " doesn't really work because Google shows " in the dashboard. Also unicode or escaping doesn't work because the JS still sees it as a single quote.
        Parameters:
        in -
        Returns:
        Returns the string with single quotes replaced by double quotes
